Getting started

  1. Go to Add-ons > Scratch Blocks > .
  2. Choose the version of Scratch you'd like to use.
  3. Choose the language (if you want something other than English).
  4. Type the blocks you'd like to use. Some block types require certain punctuation or other characters to display correctly. See the block syntax guide for details.
  5. Click "" to make sure your blocks look correct.
  6. Choose the image size for your blocks. Higher numbers are higher resolution.
  7. Click "" to add the blocks to your document/slide.

Tutorial

If you'd like to see a visual tutorial, click here to open it in a new window. You will be taken to an external service, called Iorad, which hosts the tutorial. You can read their privacy policy here.

What do I type for the blocks?

For many blocks, you just type the text that appears in the block; one block per line. However, some blocks require extra punctuation to display correctly. See the syntax guide for a full list of each block type.

Why are the blocks red?

Any block that is not recognized as a valid Scratch block is displayed in red. This likely means you are missing a punctuation mark or other character in your block. Check the syntax guide to see what you need to type for each block.
